item.title: PrismRAG: Boosting RAG Factuality with Distractor Resilience and Strategized Reasoning
item.description: arXiv:2507.18857v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) often falls short when retrieved context includes confusing semi-relevant passages, or when answering questions require deep contextual understanding and reasoning. We propose an efficient fine-tuning framework, ca...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> augmented, retrieval, LLM, model, framework | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>

item.title: Towards Improving Long-Tail Entity Predictions in Temporal Knowledge Graphs through Global Similarity and Weighted Sampling
item.description: arXiv:2507.18977v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Temporal Knowledge Graph (TKG) completion models traditionally assume access to the entire graph during training. This overlooks challenges stemming from the evolving nature of TKGs, such as: (i) the model's requirement to generalize and assimilate ne...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> augmented, paper, model, framework, arxiv | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>

item.title: KAG - KAG is a logical form-guided reasoning and retrieval framework based on OpenSPG engine and LLMs. It is used to build logical reasoning and factual Q&A solutions for professional domain knowledge bases. It can effectively overcome the shortcomings of the traditional RAG vector similarity calculation model.
item.description: KAG is a logical form-guided reasoning and retrieval framework based on OpenSPG engine and LLMs. It is used to build logical reasoning and factual Q&A solutions for professional domain knowledge bases. It can effectively overcome the shortcomings of the traditional RAG vector similarity calculation model.<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> GitHub | <strong>Keywords:</strong> retrieval, LLM, model, framework, knowledge base | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
